summary: This document is an email chain from December 2019 regarding a request for notes from an interview related to the Epstein case. It involves an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York and appears to be coordinating with law enforcement on the investigation.

persons.name: N. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of an email request for interview notes related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: Mentioned in the email signature as part of a joint task force investigating child exploitation and human trafficking.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the initial email request for interview notes, indicating prosecutorial involvement in the Epstein case.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The prosecutor is requesting interview notes from the FBI agent, indicating coordination on the investigation.

connections.person1: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
connections.description: Both are part of or associated with law enforcement task forces investigating child exploitation and human trafficking.

events.title: Request for Interview Notes
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney requests notes from an interview related to the Epstein investigation.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The email chain shows ongoing investigative activity in the Epstein case as of December 2019.
The request for interview notes indicates coordination between federal prosecutors and FBI agents.
The involvement of a Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force highlights the nature of the investigation.
The document originates from the Southern District of New York, which was handling the Epstein prosecution.
